intro: Impatiens bisaccata, commonly known as the two-bag impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that split open when mature, releasing seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Impatiens bisaccata thrives in moist, shady environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
